g.text: We used the QRA detection scheme of Kornhuber
but in this case applied it to
near-surface temperature rather than upper level winds, to develop a zonal mean QRA temperature fingerprint.
We used the Jun-Aug (JJA) 1979–2015 ERA interim reanalysis (2.5°
ature profiles were calculated using z
1000 mb daily data over the full Northern Hemisphere (0°N–90°N) in
37 steps (2.5°). We focused on long duration (
10 days) wavenumber 7 events to define QRA-favorable time
intervals, and confined zonal-mean profiles to the mid-latitude latitude range (25N–75N) analyzed in previous
. Such events have been shown to be closely related to Northern Hemisphere JJA heat extremes
fingerprint was interpolated to a 5° latitude grid that is consistent with the grid of the model simulations and
observational datas (see below) and centered on zero. This yields an 11 element zero-centered row vector that
is the QRA series for each member of the multimodel ensemble (colored curves) along with the multimodel
mean (black) series. The corresponding multimodel mean QRA series are shown along with the exatropical
) anthropogenic-only simulations, along with the linear
